Types

HttpxDefect = ref object of Defect
Defect raised when something HTTPX-specific fails 
OnRequest = proc (req: Request): Future[void] {....gcsafe, gcsafe.}
Callback used to handle HTTP requests 
Request = object
  client*: SocketHandle ## The underlying operating system socket handle associated with the request client connection.
                        ## May be closed; you should check by calling "closed" on this Request object before interacting with its client socket.
An HTTP request 
Settings = object
  port*: Port                ## The port to bind to
  bindAddr*: string          ## The address to bind to
  listener*: Socket ## Socket to use, if nil the socket is created from bindAddr and port
                    ## The socket must be listening, and it will be set non blocking
  ## The number of threads to serve on
HTTP server settings

Consts

httpxClientBufDefaultSize = 256
The default size of the client read buffer. A custom size can be set by defining httpxClientBufSize. 
httpxClientBufSize {.intdefine.} = 256
The size of the client read buffer. Defaults to httpxClientBufDefaultSize.

proc body(req: Request): Option[string] {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Retrieves the body of the request. 
func closed(req: Request): bool {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
If the client has disconnected from the server or not. 
proc forget(req: Request) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Unregisters the underlying request's client socket from httpx's event loop.

This is useful when you want to register req.client in your own event loop, for example when wanting to integrate httpx into a websocket library.

proc headers(req: Request): Option[HttpHeaders] {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Parses the request's data to get the headers.

    tags: [], forbids: [].}

proc run(onRequest: OnRequest) {.inline, ...raises: [ResourceExhaustedError,
    Exception, OSError, ValueError, KeyError], tags: [RootEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    ReadIOEffect, TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Starts the HTTP server with default settings. Calls onRequest for each request.

See the other run proc for more info.

proc run(onRequest: OnRequest; settings: Settings) {.
    ...raises: [ResourceExhaustedError, Exception, OSError, ValueError, KeyError],
    tags: [RootEffect, WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Starts the HTTP server and calls onRequest for each request.

The onRequest procedure returns a Future[void] type. But unlike most asynchronous procedures in Nim, it can return nil for better performance, when no async operations are needed.

proc runAsync(onRequest: OnRequest): owned(Future[void]) {.inline,
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Starts the HTTP server with default settings. Calls onRequest for each request.

See the other run proc for more info.

proc runAsync(onRequest: OnRequest; settings: Settings): owned(Future[void]) {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Starts the HTTP server and calls onRequest for each request.

The onRequest procedure returns a Future[void] type. But unlike most asynchronous procedures in Nim, it can return nil for better performance, when no async operations are needed.

proc send(req: Request; body: string; code = Http200) {.inline,
    ...raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Sends a HTTP 200 OK response with the specified body.

Warning: This can only be called once in the OnRequest callback.

proc send(req: Request; code: HttpCode) {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Responds with the specified HttpCode. The body of the response is the same as the HttpCode description. 
proc send(req: Request; code: HttpCode; body: string;
          contentLength: Option[int]; headers = "") {.inline,
    ...raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Responds with the specified HttpCode and body.

Warning: This can only be called once in the OnRequest callback.

proc send(req: Request; code: HttpCode; body: string;
          contentLength: Option[string]; headers = "") {.inline,
    ...deprecated: "Use Option[int] for contentLength parameter",
    raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Deprecated: Use Option[int] for contentLength parameter 
proc unsafeSend(req: Request; data: string) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Sends the specified data on the request socket.

This function can be called as many times as necessary.

It does not check whether the socket is in a state that can be written so be careful when using it.

Templates

template send(req: Request; code: HttpCode; body: string; headers = "")

Responds with the specified HttpCode and body.

Warning: This can only be called once in the OnRequest callback.
